001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.output;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
004import java.lang.annotation.Inherited;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008import java.util.function.Function;
009import java.util.stream.Stream;
010
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
012
013/**
014 * Annotation to mark data classes for export during simulation execution.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * Classes annotated with {@code @Export} are recognized by the simulation
018 * exporter and are processed according to the specified parameters. The
019 * annotation provides metadata about the export stage, output file name,
020 * expected record size, selector function for data extraction, and the writer
021 * class responsible for handling the export.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * By using this annotation, developers can easily designate which data classes
025 * should be exported at different stages of the simulation, and how they should
026 * be processed and written to output files.
027 *
028 * @author Rob Challen
029 */
030@Inherited
031@Target(ElementType.TYPE)
032@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
033public @interface Export {
034
035        /**
036         * Functional interface for selecting data to export from an Outbreak
037         * simulation.
038         *
039         * <p>
040         * Implementations of this interface define how to extract and transform data
041         * from the Outbreak object into a stream of records that can be written to
042         * output files. The selector function is specified in the {@code @Export}
043         * annotation and is used by the exporter to retrieve the relevant data for
044         * export at the appropriate stage of the simulation.
045         */
046        public static interface Selector
047                        extends Function<Outbreak, Stream<? extends CSVWriter.Writeable>> {}
048
049        /**
050         * Enumeration of export stages during simulation execution.
051         *
052         * <p>
053         * Defines the stages at which data can be exported: BASELINE for initial
054         * model parameters, START for simulation start, UPDATE for per‑step updates,
055         * and FINISH for final outputs after simulation completion.
056         */
057        public static enum Stage {
058                /**
059                 * Export data at the baseline stage, typically for initial model
060                 * parameters.
061                 */
062                BASELINE,
063                /**
064                 * Export data at the start of the simulation, typically for initial
065                 * conditions.
066                 */
067                START,
068                /**
069                 * Export data during simulation updates, typically for time‑indexed
070                 * records.
071                 */
072                UPDATE,
073                /**
074                 * Export data at the finish of the simulation, typically for final
075                 * outputs.
076                 */
077                FINISH
078        }
079
080        /**
081         * Get the selector class responsible for extracting data from the Outbreak
082         * simulation for export. The selector class implements the Export.Selector
083         * interface and defines the logic for transforming the Outbreak object into
084         * a stream of records that can be written to the output file.
085         *
086         * @return the class that implements the Selector interface and provides the
087         *         logic for extracting data from the Outbreak simulation for export.
088         */
089        Class<? extends Selector> selector();
090
091        /**
092         * Get the indicative cache size of the records to be exported.
093         *
094         * @return the expected number of fields in each record; used for validation
095         *         and to ensure consistency with the writer's output format
096         */
097        int size();
098
099        /**
100         * Get the export stage at which the data should be exported.
101         *
102         * @return the stage of the simulation (BASELINE, START, UPDATE, FINISH) at
103         *         which the data should be exported
104         */
105        Stage stage();
106
107        /**
108         * Get the output file name for the export.
109         *
110         * @return the name of the output file to which the exported data will be
111         *         written relative to the output directory; should include the
112         *         appropriate file extension.
113         */
114        String value();
115
116        /**
117         * Get the writer class responsible for handling the export of the data to
118         * the specified output file.
119         *
120         * @return the class that implements the OutputWriter interface and defines
121         *         how to write the exported data to the output file in the desired
122         *         format (e.g., CSV, DuckDB).
123         */
124        @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
125        Class<? extends OutputWriter> writer();
126
127}
